p: Our results showed that the current suitable habitat will be reduced by 11% (378,861 km 2) across Central Asia by 2,050 (Table 3) due to climate change. The most suitable habitat is predicted to be lost in India (26% loss), Pakistan (17%), and Nepal (13%). In China, 290,200 km 2 (13%) of suitable habitat is predicted to be lost by 2,050 (Table 3). However, a small increase in suitable habitat for brown bear is predicted in Uzbekistan relative to the entire study area (10,271 km 2), but a relatively large gain within the country (51%; Table 3; Figure 6).
